channel.title: Might make a code generator - please read :)
channel.description:
So, a couple years back (3 to be exact) when I was an immature little kiddie, I made this code generator (with Flash) which generated code [size=5pt]no shit[/size] that might be useful for a server. Like generating code for common item spawns (Barrows, Runes, etc.) There were preset item and teleport commands that could just be copy and pasted, custom ones could also be made. (by specifying coordinates/item IDs) Now my question is, should I recreate this? Would anyone use it? I would love to hear more from you guys, feedback/recommendations are highly appreciated :)
Thanks for reading and plus vote on the poll ;)

item.description:
@classic wrote:

There will still be a lot of people having bracket errors so it’s all good I guess xD.

That is because there just fucking stupid.

item.title: Might make a code generator - please read :)
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

[quote=“DemonWars, post:3, topic:390495”]i like the idea, i have a few ideas:

(508 plz)

1: a npc talk generator
2: a command generator
3: a npc spawn generator
4: a NPC variables generator[/quote]
Someone wants to be spoonfed :instantcool:

Yeah, it might stop some people from asking “HOW MAKE CUMAND TANKS IN ADVENCE LAWL”
But you’ll probably get banned from some noob saying “VIRUS” so no one else will download because he thinks “THIS WAY I CANZ ONLY HAZ AND I HAZ SUPER SERBER” or when people post in the help section, someone says to look for this program, they will say “Can’t find” even though they didnt do shit and are too lazy and only want to be spoonfed…

Conclusion, i honestly dont think it would be the best idea, because its just giving the noobs moar baby mush.

Read full topic

item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Instead of creating a program that lets people copy/paste some data into their source(which may or may not work), you could instead create a new way of commands to be loaded/handled.

owait, this is MoparScape =\

item.source: Might make a code generator - please read :)

item.title: Might make a code generator - please read :)
item.dc:creator: @Carazon Carazon ™
item.description:
@Carazon wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:14, topic:390495”][quote author=Carazon ™ link=topic=486407.msg3564611#msg3564611 date=1302551400]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=486407.msg3564595#msg3564595 date=1302550740]

i like the idea, i have a few ideas:
(508 plz)
2: a command generator
[/quote]Search ‘508 command generator’ on this site

That’s pretty nice, but there’s just one problem. Not everyone will bother to download and/or trust a program they have to install. Good thing with flash is that you can make a really nice, customizable and user-friendly interface, all in a web-browser. I was wondering if I could perhaps use the code provided by your program in mine (although it’s just code o.o’)?
[/quote]Just make it in Java instead[/quote]
Nah, I think I’ll stick with Flash since you can trust it more than a Java Applet. And making a nice GUI is easier in Flash.

Read full topic

item.title: Might make a code generator - please read :)
item.dc:creator: @Carazon Carazon ™
item.description:
@Carazon wrote:

I think I’ll get started with this anyhow, I have nothing better to do. There’s just one problem: I haven’t used RSPS’ in 4 years and forgot about the basic stuff I’d like to add. If anyone’s up to providing me some example code for a common stuff like a basic structure for a :: command, teleports, item spawners and maybe some of DemonWars’ ideas, I’ll be glad to add your name to the credits page

Read full topic

item.title: Might make a code generator - please read :)
item.dc:creator: @mark033 mark033
item.description:
@mark033 wrote:

My main problem with automatically adding the code to the classes is that people who maybe can’t be bothered to learn won’t. Whereas if you make anyone who wants to use it do it themselves at least they learn a bit.

Read full topic
item.source: Might make a code generator - please read :)

item.title: Might make a code generator - please read :)
item.dc:creator: @Carazon Carazon ™
item.description:
@Carazon wrote:

mark033:

I don’t like the idea of automatically adding it. I think you should include with it how to add the codes it makes to sources and explain how they work. That way, people can use the tool to learn the codes and what does what in them, and eventually they’ll be able to do it themselves.

I was planning on making it optional anyways That sounds like a good idea, too. Thanks for the feedback

@Newty: Seriously, you remember that? xD Wow your brain is epic. Are they useless nowadays?

Read full topic

@DemonWars: I could try and make it support 317 and 508. Also, what do you think about automatically inserting the code into the java file? Sorry, I haven’t used RSPS for 4 years now, I forgot alot of stuff, I’d need some help with the basic structure of those codes. Thanks for the ideas
